facts: Plaintiff sued defendant for personal injuries from a car accident
Case went to trial and plaintiff lost on the merits
Plaintiff now sues same defendant for property damage from the same accident
Property damage claim was not raised in the first lawsuit
asp_facts: claim(c1). claim_type(c1, res_judicata). plaintiff(c1, plaintiff). defendant(c1, defendant). prior_judgment(c1, yes). judgment_on_merits(c1, yes). same_parties(c1, yes). same_transaction(c1, yes). claim_could_have_been_raised(c1, yes). claim_preclusion(c1, yes).
question: Is the property damage claim barred by res judicata?
rationale: Under claim preclusion (res judicata), a final judgment on the merits bars relitigation of any claim that was or could have been raised in the prior action. The property damage claim arises from the same transaction and could have been raised in the first lawsuit.
